Description: Led by Charles F. Chandler, the first meeting for organization of the American Chemical Society (ACS) is held at the New York College of Pharmacy. Chemists from New York City and the vicinity are invited to attend.
Chandler appoints John W. Draper as the first President of ACS.
The first Regular Meeting of the American Chemical Society is held.
Dr. H. Endemann delivers the first paper before the society: "The Determination of Relative Effectiveness of Disinfectants."
ACS is incorporated under the laws of the State of New York. Publication of Proceedings [of the American Chemical Society] begins.
Ira Remsen begins publication of the American Chemical Journal (1879-1913).
